game.this-action-will-reshuffle-all-your-card: This action will reshuffle all your cards in the deck and draw a new hand of cards. You can only do this once per game.

game-node.internal-network-hub: Connects devices inside an organization. A compromised hub can let attackers intercept or reroute internal communications.
game-node.database-server: A server that stores and manages critical data such as user credentials and business records. If compromised, attackers can steal or alter data.
game-node.web-server: Hosts websites and applications. It's often the first target in cyberattacks such as DDoS or code injection.
game-node.cloud-storage: A service to store files online. Without protection, it can lead to data leaks or unauthorized access.
game-node.iot-device: Smart devices connected to a network. Often unsecured, making them easy targets for hackers.
game-node.email-server: Handles sending and receiving emails. It's a common target for phishing and malware attacks.
game-node.workstation: A user's device like a PC or laptop. It's a common entry point for malware and social engineering attacks.

game-defense.firewall-edu: It acts like a gatekeeper—allowing safe traffic and blocking potentially harmful connections to or from a network or device.
game-defense.ids-edu: Monitors network or system behavior for signs of attack. It alerts defenders when something unusual is detected.
game-defense.antivirus-edu: Scans for, detects, and removes malicious software like viruses, trojans, or worms on devices like workstations.
game-defense.network-segmentation-edu: Divides a network into smaller zones, so if one part is compromised, the rest stays secure—like isolating fires in separate rooms.
game-defense.anomaly-detection-edu: Uses behavior models to find things that don't belong, such as unexpected data transfers or login times.
game-defense.spam-filter-edu: Automatically detects and blocks unwanted or dangerous emails—like phishing attempts—before they reach your inbox.
game-defense.encryption-edu: Converts data into unreadable code unless you have the key. Protects sensitive information in storage or transit.
game-defense.mfa-edu: Requires more than just a password—like a code from your phone or fingerprint—making it harder for attackers to break in.

game-card.network-scanning-desc: Scan the network. Reveal the data token of target node.
game-card.social-engineering-desc: Manipulate defender action. Reveal 2 random defender cards in hand.
game-card.port-scanning-desc: Scan for active port in target node. Reveal 1 active defense of target node.
game-card.sql-injection-desc: Inject an SQL payload. Steal 1 data token from Database Server or Web Server.
game-card.phishing-attack-desc: Trick user into revealing credential. Steal 1 data token from a Workstation.
game-card.zero-day-exploit-desc: Bypass all defenses to steal 1 data token from a node. After use reveal 1 random attacker card.
game-card.firewall-upgrade-desc: Add firewall on Database Server or Web Server. Block 1 attack on target node.
game-card.mfa-implementation-desc: Implement Multi-Factor Authentication. Block attack to Workstation or Email Server for 1 attack.
game-card.network-segmentation-desc: Segregate the network. Target node cannot be attacked this round.
game-card.security-awareness-desc: Train opeartor security awareness. Reveal 2 attacker card in hand.
game-card.network-scanning-edu: Scans a network to find active devices and open ports. This helps attackers identify potential entry points.
game-card.social-engineering-edu: Manipulates human behavior to trick users into giving up sensitive information. It's often used to bypass technical defenses.
game-card.port-scanning-edu: Looks for open or vulnerable ports on devices. Attackers use this to find weak spots to exploit.
game-card.vpn-tunneling-edu: Creates encrypted connections to hide traffic. Attackers may use it to avoid detection while moving within a network.
game-card.lateral-movement-edu: Spreads access from one device to another inside a network. This lets attackers reach high-value systems undetected.
game-card.sql-injection-edu: Injects malicious code into insecure database inputs. It can be used to steal, alter, or delete data.
game-card.phishing-attack-edu: Sends fake emails or messages to trick users. The goal is often to steal passwords or deliver malware.
game-card.zero-day-exploit-edu: Takes advantage of unknown software flaws. Since there's no patch yet, these attacks are very dangerous.
game-card.ransomware-attack-edu: Encrypts files and demands a ransom to unlock them. It can shut down operations and cause major damage.
game-card.man-in-the-middle-edu: Intercepts data between two parties during communication. Attackers can steal or modify the information silently.
game-card.ddos-attack-edu: Overwhelms systems with a flood of fake traffic. This can crash websites or online services.
game-card.log-tampering-edu: Changes or deletes system logs to hide activity. This makes it hard for defenders to trace what happened.
game-card.backdoor-installation-edu: Installs hidden access points into a system. These allow attackers to return later without being noticed.
game-card.privilege-escalation-edu: Uses flaws to gain higher access rights. It lets attackers perform actions normally restricted to admins.
game-card.session-hijacking-edu: Takes control of a valid user session. Attackers then impersonate the user without needing login credentials.
game-card.firewall-upgrade-edu: Improves the ability to block dangerous connections. A stronger firewall stops more types of unauthorized access.
game-card.access-control-policy-edu: Defines who is allowed to access what. This limits damage by keeping users in their appropriate roles.
game-card.mfa-implementation-edu: Adds a second step to the login process. Even if a password is stolen, access is still blocked.
game-card.endpoint-protection-edu: Secures individual devices like laptops and desktops. It prevents malware and stops attackers at the device level.
game-card.network-segmentation-edu: Breaks a network into smaller zones. If one part is breached, the rest remains secure.
game-card.obfuscation-shield-edu: Hides code and system details from outsiders. This makes it harder for attackers to understand and exploit systems.
game-card.security-awareness-edu: Trains users to recognize and avoid threats. Educated users are the first line of defense against attacks.
game-card.honeypot-edu: Acts as a fake target to lure and trap attackers. It helps defenders study tactics and delay real damage.
game-card.network-monitoring-edu: Tracks data traffic across the network in real time. This helps detect unusual or malicious behavior quickly.
game-card.log-analysis-edu: Examines activity logs to find patterns or warning signs. It can uncover attacks that may go unnoticed.
game-card.data-recovery-protocol-edu: Restores lost or damaged files after an attack. It's essential for bouncing back from ransomware or data loss.
game-card.vulnerability-patching-edu: Fixes known flaws in software or systems. Regular updates reduce the number of ways attackers can get in.
game-card.forensic-investigation-edu: Digs into digital evidence after a breach. This helps identify what was affected and how the attack happened.
game-card.incident-response-edu: Provides a structured way to react to cyber attacks. It aims to contain damage and restore systems quickly.
game-card.threat-intelligence-edu: Gathers data about cyber threats and attacker behavior. It helps predict and prevent future attacks.

game-effect.ignored-ignoreddefenses-defense-s-but-at: ignored {ignoreDefenses} defense(s), but attack blocked by remaining defenses
game-effect.attack-blocked-by-defense-no-data-token-: attack blocked by defense, no data token stolen

game-effect.no-data-token-in-target-node: no data token in target node
game-effect.gamenode-name-defense-is-already-maxed-n: {gameNode} defense is already maxed, no new defense added
game-effect.no-attempted-attack-to-ignore-in-target-: no attempted attack to ignore in target node
game-effect.no-defenses-in-target-node-to-reveal: no defenses in target node to reveal
game-effect.revealcards-card-s-revealed-from-your-ha: {revealCards} card(s) revealed from your hand by the {by}
game-effect.revealcards-cards-revealed-from-your-han: {revealCards} card(s) revealed from your hand to the {to}
game-effect.from-has-revealed-revealcards-cards-from: {from} has revealed {revealCards} card(s) from their hand to you
game-effect.defender-has-healed-tokentoheal-data-tok: defender has healed {tokenToHeal} data token(s) from {gameNode}, stolenTokens is now {stolenTokens}
game-effect.no-data-tokens-to-heal-in-gamenode-name: no data tokens to heal in {gameNode}
